quest.name: Whistle While You Shirk
journal:
 Quest Sync
The elderly miner is squinting at you with great intensity.

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: You there! New lasslad! Where are the others?

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: Don't try to play me for a fool, I know what they're up to. No good, that's what! Expect me to pay them for shirking their duties, do they? Bah!

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: Go and get them, will you? It's time I gave them a stern talking to!

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: The youth of today, what a shower of shite! In my day we had it tough. We'd be woken up half a bell before we'd went to bed, eat a handful of hot gravel, and─ What are you still gawping at me for, you bloody fool!?

dialogue.name: MINERA03495
dialogue.text: Ah gods, my aching head... I feel like death warmed up...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems the man is suffering from a hangover. If you were to psych him up, perhaps he might be more inclined to return to his duties.

dialogue.name: MINERA03495
dialogue.text: All right, all right! Enough of your posing!

dialogue.name: MINERA03495
dialogue.text: If going back to work's what it takes for you to leave me alone, so be it!

dialogue.name: MINERB03495
dialogue.text: <sigh> Nothing's going my way... I haven't had a decent haul in ages. I might as well just hang up my pickaxe for good.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The man seems to be lacking in motivation. Perhaps if you were to rally his spirits, he might be willing to return to work.

dialogue.name: MINERB03495
dialogue.text: I don't know who you are or what you're doing, but your enthusiasm is somehow...infectious!

dialogue.name: MINERB03495
dialogue.text: Yes, I should be thankful for what I have! I've got a steady job, a sort of beautiful home, what more could I ask for? Heigh ho, heigh ho, it's back to work I go!

dialogue.name: MINERC03495
dialogue.text: Why would she leave me? There's nothing for her in Eulmore! Whatever will I do now?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The man is clearly upset and in no fit state to work. If someone were to comfort him, he might come to his senses.

dialogue.name: MINERC03495
dialogue.text: “There, there?” What does that even mean, anyway? There are people who need me? There is still work to be done?

dialogue.name: MINERC03495
dialogue.text: That's it! I should forget my sorrows by burying myself in my work! Ah, a poor choice of words considering I'm a miner... But enough procrastinating, there's digging to be done!

dialogue.name: MINERA03495
dialogue.text: Nothing cures a hangover better than spending hours smashing rocks in a dingy mine... Ungh. Kill me now.

dialogue.name: MINERB03495
dialogue.text: Ha ha, those rocks won't know what hit them!

dialogue.name: MINERC03495
dialogue.text: Who needs her anyway? I'm married to my job!

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: So, the four of you finally decided to show up and do some bloody work, then?

dialogue.name: MINERA03495
dialogue.text: Four!? But this womanbloke's not part of our team, is shehe? As far as I can tell, shehe's just passing through!

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: Eh!? What are you prattling about now?

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: Ha ha! My mistake! When you get to my age, one person-shaped blur looks much like all the others. Must be these damned eyes of mine.

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: Still, we could use an extra pair of hands around here. I daresay you're worth more than all of these slack-jawed layabouts put together.

dialogue.name: MINEROLD03495
dialogue.text: But if you're not here for the mining, you might as well take this as payment for rounding up my workers. Gods help me, they're all I've got.
